member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteGlobeServerCache
member.summary: Deletes a layer or layers of an existing globe service cache and all tiles in them.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteGlobeServerCache.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The globe service whose layer caches you want to delete. (In, Required)
The layers in the globe service whose caches will be deleted. All layers of the service are included by default. If a layer is excluded the layer's cache will not be deleted. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteGlobeServerCache.service
member.summary: The globe service whose layer caches you want to delete. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteGlobeServerCache.Layer
member.summary: The layers in the globe service whose caches will be deleted. All layers of the service are included by default. If a layer is excluded the layer's cache will not be deleted. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteGlobeServerCache.out_service_url
member.summary: Output Service URL (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteGlobeServerCache.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteGlobeServerCache.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteGlobeServerCache.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteGlobeServerCache.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.DeleteGlobeServerCache.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles
member.summary: Creates and updates tiles in an existing globe service cache. This tool is used to create new tiles or to replace missing tiles, overwrite outdated tiles, or add new tiles. All these actions can be defined by rectangular extents or by a polygon feature class. When creating new tiles, you can choose whether to create only empty tiles or re-create all tiles.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The globe service whose cache tiles you want to update. (In, Required)
The layers to include in the cache. (In, Required)
Choose a mode for updating the cache. The two modes are: (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.service
member.summary: The globe service whose cache tiles you want to update. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.in_layers
member.summary: The layers to include in the cache. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.update_mode
member.summary: Choose a mode for updating the cache. The two modes are: (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.num_of_caching_service_instances
member.summary: The total number of instances of the System/CachingTools service that you want to dedicate toward running this tool. You can increase the maximum number of instances per machine of the System/CachingTools service using the Service Editor window available through an administrative connection to ArcGIS Server. Ensure your server machines can support the chosen number of instances. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.area_of_interest
member.summary: Defines an area of interest to constrain where tiles will be created or deleted. This can be a feature class, or it can be a feature that you interactively define in ArcMap. This parameter is useful if you want to manage tiles for irregularly shaped areas. It's also useful in situations where you want to precache some areas and leave less-visited areas uncached. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.ignore_status
member.summary: This parameter allows you to track the status of your caching if you are creating tiles based on feature class boundaries (see the update_feature_class parameter). (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.update_extent
member.summary: Rectangular extent at which tiles should be created or deleted, depending on the value of the update_mode parameter. You can type the extent values or choose an extent from an existing data source. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.out_service_url
member.summary: Output Service URL (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageGlobeServerCacheTiles.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UploadServiceDefinition
member.summary: Uploads and publishes a GIS service to a specified GIS server based on a staged service definition file (.sd).

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UploadServiceDefinition.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

param.name: in_sd_file
param.summary: The service definition file (.sd) that contains all the information needed to publish a GIS service. (In, Required)

member.param: The server connection. You can use the ArcGIS Server connections listed under the GIS Servers node in the Catalog window, or you can browse to a folder where you store server connection files. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UploadServiceDefinition.in_sd_file
member.summary: The service definition file (.sd) that contains all the information needed to publish a GIS service. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UploadServiceDefinition.in_server
member.summary: The server connection. You can use the ArcGIS Server connections listed under the GIS Servers node in the Catalog window, or you can browse to a folder where you store server connection files. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UploadServiceDefinition.in_service_name
member.summary: Overrides the service name currently specified in the service definition with a new name. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UploadServiceDefinition.in_cluster
member.summary: Changes the cluster to which the service has been assigned. You must choose from clusters that are available on the specified server. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UploadServiceDefinition.in_folder_type
member.summary: Specifies the source for the folder. The default is a folder from the service definition. You can also choose a folder already existing on the specified server or a new folder to be created once you publish this service. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UploadServiceDefinition.in_folder
member.summary: The folder for the service. The default is the folder specified in the service definition. If you chose NEW for the folder type, provide a new folder name. If you chose EXISTING for the folder type, choose an existing folder on the server. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UploadServiceDefinition.in_startupType
member.summary: Specifies the start state of the service immediately after publishing. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UploadServiceDefinition.in_override
member.summary: Specifies whether the sharing properties set in the service definition will be overridden. These properties define if, and how, you are sharing your service with ArcGIS Online. Sharing your service with ArcGIS Online exposes it for others to use. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UploadServiceDefinition.in_my_contents
member.summary: Specifies whether the service will be shared on ArcGIS Online. All shared services are available through My Contents. Even if you only want to share with a specific group in your organization, the service will also be shared through My Contents. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UploadServiceDefinition.in_public
member.summary: Specifies whether the service will be available to the public. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UploadServiceDefinition.in_organization
member.summary: Specifies whether the service will be shared with your organization. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UploadServiceDefinition.in_groups
member.summary: A list of group names with which the service will be shared. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UploadServiceDefinition.out_soap_svc_url
member.summary: SOAP Service URL (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UploadServiceDefinition.out_rest_svc_url
member.summary: REST Service URL (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UploadServiceDefinition.out_mapServiceItemID
member.summary: Hosted Map Service Item ID (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UploadServiceDefinition.out_featServiceItemID
member.summary: Hosted Feature Service Item ID (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UploadServiceDefinition.out_cached_service
member.summary: Cached Service (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UploadServiceDefinition.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.StageService
member.summary: Stages a service definition. A staged service definition (.sd) file contains all the necessary information needed to publish a GIS service, including data that must be copied to the server because it does not appear in the server's data store.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.StageService.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input draft service definition. Service definition drafts can be created using ArcGIS Desktop. See About draft services for more information. You can also use the arcpy.mapping function CreateMapSDDraft to create draft service definitions. (In, Required)
The resulting service definition. The default is to write the service definition to the same directory as the draft service definition. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.StageService.in_service_definition_draft
member.summary: The input draft service definition. Service definition drafts can be created using ArcGIS Desktop. See About draft services for more information. You can also use the arcpy.mapping function CreateMapSDDraft to create draft service definitions. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.StageService.out_service_definition
member.summary: The resulting service definition. The default is to write the service definition to the same directory as the draft service definition. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.StageService.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.StageService.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.StageService.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.StageService.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.StageService.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.SignInToPortal
member.summary: Allows you to sign in to portals. If you are publishing to an ArcGIS Online portal you need to be signed in to ArcGIS Online in order to publish. For those organizations that would like to use ArcGIS Online behind the firewall or in their own private cloud, there is a version that you can install and use on your own computer networks. It is called Portal for ArcGIS.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.SignInToPortal.#ctor(System.String,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: Portal for ArcGIS username. This parameter is optional for portals with Integrated Windows Authentication. (In, Required)

param.name: password
param.summary: Portal for ArcGIS password. This parameter is optional for portals with Integrated Windows Authentication. (In, Required)

member.param: The Sign In To Portal tool reads the URL set in Desktop Administrator. Any user entered value is ignored. The default value is URL for the ArcGIS portal currently chosen by the user in Desktop Administrator. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.SignInToPortal.username
member.summary: Portal for ArcGIS username. This parameter is optional for portals with Integrated Windows Authentication. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.SignInToPortal.password
member.summary: Portal for ArcGIS password. This parameter is optional for portals with Integrated Windows Authentication. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.SignInToPortal.portal_url
member.summary: The Sign In To Portal tool reads the URL set in Desktop Administrator. Any user entered value is ignored. The default value is URL for the ArcGIS portal currently chosen by the user in Desktop Administrator. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.SignInToPortal.out_results
member.summary: Tool Succeeded (out, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.SignInToPortal.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.SignInToPortal.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ConvertMapServerCacheStorageFormat
member.summary: Converts the storage of a map or image service cache between the exploded format and the compact format. The tool converts the format in place, meaning it does not make a copy of the existing format of the cache. Instead, it creates the new format of the cache in the same cache folder and deletes the old format.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ConvertMapServerCacheStorageFormat.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The map or image service whose cache format you want to convert. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ConvertMapServerCacheStorageFormat.input_service
member.summary: The map or image service whose cache format you want to convert. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ConvertMapServerCacheStorageFormat.num_of_caching_service_instances
member.summary: The total number of instances of the System/CachingTools service that you want to dedicate toward running this tool. You can increase the maximum number of instances per machine of the System/CachingTools service using the Service Editor window available through an administrative connection to ArcGIS Server. Ensure your server machines can support the chosen number of instances. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ConvertMapServerCacheStorageFormat.out_job_url
member.summary: Output Map Service URL (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ConvertMapServerCacheStorageFormat.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache
member.summary: Creates the tiling scheme and preparatory folders for a map or image service cache. After running this tool, use the Manage Map Server Cache Tiles tool to add tiles to the cache.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.#ctor(System.Object,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The map or image service to be cached. (In, Required)
The parent directory for the cache. This must be a registered ArcGIS Server cache directory. (In, Required)

Specifies how the tiling scheme will be defined. You can define a new tiling scheme with this tool or browse to a predefined tiling scheme file (.xml). A predefined scheme can be created by running the Generate Map Server Cache Tiling Scheme tool. (In, Required)
Specifies how the tiles will be scaled. (In, Required)
The number of scale levels to create in the cache. This option is disabled if you create a custom list of scales. (In, Required)

The dots per inch (DPI) of the intended output device. If a DPI is chosen that does not match the resolution of the output device, the scale of the map tile will appear incorrect. The default value is 96. (In, Required)

Specifies the width and height of the cache tiles in pixels. For the best balance between performance and manageability, avoid deviating from standard widths of 256 by 256 or 512 by 512. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.input_service
member.summary: The map or image service to be cached. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.service_cache_directory
member.summary: The parent directory for the cache. This must be a registered ArcGIS Server cache directory. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.tiling_scheme_type
member.summary: Specifies how the tiling scheme will be defined. You can define a new tiling scheme with this tool or browse to a predefined tiling scheme file (.xml). A predefined scheme can be created by running the Generate Map Server Cache Tiling Scheme tool. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.scales_type
member.summary: Specifies how the tiles will be scaled. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.num_of_scales
member.summary: The number of scale levels to create in the cache. This option is disabled if you create a custom list of scales. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.dots_per_inch
member.summary: The dots per inch (DPI) of the intended output device. If a DPI is chosen that does not match the resolution of the output device, the scale of the map tile will appear incorrect. The default value is 96. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.tile_size
member.summary: Specifies the width and height of the cache tiles in pixels. For the best balance between performance and manageability, avoid deviating from standard widths of 256 by 256 or 512 by 512. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.predefined_tiling_scheme
member.summary: The path to a predefined tiling scheme file (usually named conf.xml). (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.tile_origin
member.summary: The origin (upper left corner) of the tiling scheme in the coordinates of the spatial reference of the source map document. The extent of the source map document must be within (but does not need to coincide with) this region. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.scales
member.summary: The scale levels available for the cache. These are not represented as fractions. Instead, use 500 to represent a scale of 1:500, for example. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.cache_tile_format
member.summary: Specifies the cache tile format. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.tile_compression_quality
member.summary: The JPEG compression quality (1â€“100). The default value is 75 for the JPEG tile format and 0 for other formats. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.CreateMapServerCache.storage_format
member.summary: Specifies the storage format of tiles. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Output Map Service URL (out, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache
member.summary: Exports tiles from a map or an image service cache as a cache dataset or tile package to a folder on disk. The tiles can be imported into other caches, or they can be accessed from ArcGIS Desktop or mobile devices as a raster dataset, independent from their parent service.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The map or image service with the cache tiles to be exported. (In, Required)

The folder into which the cache will be exported. This folder does not have to be a registered server cache directory. The ArcGIS Server account must have write access to the target cache folder. If the server account cannot be granted write access to the destination folder but the ArcGIS Desktop or ArcGIS Pro client has write access to it, choose the Copy data from server parameter. (In, Required)
Exports a cache as a cache dataset or a tile package. Tile packages are suitable for ArcGIS Runtime and ArcGIS Mobile deployments. (In, Required)

param.name: copy_data_from_server
param.summary: Set this parameter to COPY_DATA if the ArcGIS Server account cannot be granted write access to the target folder and the ArcGIS Desktop or ArcGIS Pro client has write access to it. The software exports the tiles in the server output directory before moving them to the target folder. (In, Required)

member.param: The storage format of the exported cache. (In, Required)
A list of scale levels at which tiles will be exported. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.input_service
member.summary: The map or image service with the cache tiles to be exported. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.target_cache_path
member.summary: The folder into which the cache will be exported. This folder does not have to be a registered server cache directory. The ArcGIS Server account must have write access to the target cache folder. If the server account cannot be granted write access to the destination folder but the ArcGIS Desktop or ArcGIS Pro client has write access to it, choose the Copy data from server parameter. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.export_cache_type
member.summary: Exports a cache as a cache dataset or a tile package. Tile packages are suitable for ArcGIS Runtime and ArcGIS Mobile deployments. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.copy_data_from_server
member.summary: Set this parameter to COPY_DATA if the ArcGIS Server account cannot be granted write access to the target folder and the ArcGIS Desktop or ArcGIS Pro client has write access to it. The software exports the tiles in the server output directory before moving them to the target folder. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.storage_format_type
member.summary: The storage format of the exported cache. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.scales
member.summary: A list of scale levels at which tiles will be exported. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.num_of_caching_service_instances
member.summary: The total number of instances of the System/CachingTools service that you want to dedicate toward running this tool. You can increase the maximum number of instances per machine of the System/CachingTools service using the Service Editor window available through an administrative connection to ArcGIS Server. Ensure your server machines can support the chosen number of instances. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.area_of_interest
member.summary: An area of interest that spatially constrains where tiles are exported from the cache. This parameter is useful if you want to export irregularly shaped areas, as the tool clips the cache dataset at pixel resolution. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.export_extent
member.summary: A rectangular extent defining the tiles to be exported. By default, the extent is set to the full extent of the map service into which you are importing. Note that the optional parameter on this tool, Area Of Interest, allows you to alternatively import using a polygon. It is recommended that you not provide values for both parameters for a job. If values are provided for both parameters, the Area Of Interest parameter takes precedence over Import Extent. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.overwrite
member.summary: Overwrite Tiles (in, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.output_cache_path
member.summary: Output Cache Path (out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.ToolboxDirectory
member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.ToolboxName
member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.ToolName
member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.Alias
member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ExportMapServerCache.ParameterInfo
member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.GenerateMapServerCacheTilingScheme
member.summary: Generates an XML tiling scheme file that defines the scale levels, tile dimensions, and other properties for a map service cache. This tool is useful when creating a tiling scheme to use in multiple caches. You can load the tiling scheme file when you create a cache in ArcGIS Desktop or ArcGIS Server Manager, or you can run Create Map Server Cache and pass in the tiling scheme file as a parameter.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.GenerateMapServerCacheTilingScheme.#ctor(System.Object,System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.Int32,System.Object,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The source map document to be used for the tiling scheme. (In, Required)
The data frame to be used for the tiling scheme. (In, Required)
The upper left corner of the tiling scheme, in coordinates of the spatial reference of the source data frame. (In, Required)
Path and file name of the tiling scheme file to create. (Out, Required)
Number of scale levels in the tiling scheme. (In, Required)
Scale levels to include in the tiling scheme. These are not represented as fractions. Instead, use 500 to represent a scale of 1:500, and so on. (In, Required)

The dots per inch of the intended output device. If a DPI is chosen that does not match the resolution of the output device, the scale of the map tile will appear incorrect. The default value is 96. (In, Required)

The width and height of the cache tiles in pixels. The default is 256 by 256. For the best balance between performance and manageability, avoid deviating from standard dimensions of 256 by 256 or 512 by 512. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.GenerateMapServerCacheTilingScheme.map_document
member.summary: The source map document to be used for the tiling scheme. (In, Required)

member.summary: The data frame to be used for the tiling scheme. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.GenerateMapServerCacheTilingScheme.tile_origin
member.summary: The upper left corner of the tiling scheme, in coordinates of the spatial reference of the source data frame. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.GenerateMapServerCacheTilingScheme.output_tiling_scheme
member.summary: Path and file name of the tiling scheme file to create. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.GenerateMapServerCacheTilingScheme.num_of_scales
member.summary: Number of scale levels in the tiling scheme. (In, Required)

member.summary: Scale levels to include in the tiling scheme. These are not represented as fractions. Instead, use 500 to represent a scale of 1:500, and so on. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.GenerateMapServerCacheTilingScheme.dots_per_inch
member.summary: The dots per inch of the intended output device. If a DPI is chosen that does not match the resolution of the output device, the scale of the map tile will appear incorrect. The default value is 96. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.GenerateMapServerCacheTilingScheme.tile_size
member.summary: The width and height of the cache tiles in pixels. The default is 256 by 256. For the best balance between performance and manageability, avoid deviating from standard dimensions of 256 by 256 or 512 by 512. (In, Required)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache
member.summary: Imports tiles from a folder on disk into a map or an image service cache.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.#ctor(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The map or image service into which tiles will be imported. (In, Required)
Imports a cache from a cache dataset or tile package to a cached map or image service running on the server. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.input_service
member.summary: The map or image service into which tiles will be imported. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.source_cache_type
member.summary: Imports a cache from a cache dataset or tile package to a cached map or image service running on the server. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.source_cache_dataset
member.summary: The path to the cache folder matching the data frame name. You do not have to specify a registered server cache directory; most of the time you'll specify a location on disk where tiles have been previously exported. This location should be accessible to the ArcGIS Server account. If the ArcGIS Server account cannot be granted access to this location, set the upload_data_to_server parameter to UPLOAD_DATA. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.source_tile_package
member.summary: The path to the tile package (.tpk) that will be imported. This location should be accessible to the ArcGIS Server account. When importing a tile package file to a cached map or image service, the upload_data_to_server parameter is ignored as it is automatically set to UPLOAD_DATA. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.upload_data_to_server
member.summary: Set this parameter to UPLOAD_DATA if the ArcGIS Server account does not have read access to the source cache. The tool will upload the source cache to the ArcGIS Server uploads directory before moving it to the ArcGIS Server cache directory. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.scales
member.summary: A list of scale levels at which tiles will be imported. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.num_of_caching_service_instances
member.summary: The total number of instances of the System/CachingTools service that you want to dedicate toward running this tool. You can increase the maximum number of instances per machine of the System/CachingTools service using the Service Editor window available through an administrative connection to ArcGIS Server. Ensure your server machines can support the chosen number of instances. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.area_of_interest
member.summary: An area of interest polygon that spatially constrains where tiles are imported into the cache. This parameter is useful if you want to import tiles for irregularly shaped areas, as the tool clips the cache dataset, which intersects the polygon at pixel resolution and imports it to the service cache directory. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.import_extent
member.summary: A rectangular extent defining the tiles to be imported into the cache. By default, the extent is set to the full extent of the map service into which you are importing. Note that the optional parameter on this tool, Area Of Interest, allows you to spatially constrain the imported tiles using an irregular shape. If values are provided for both parameters, the Area Of Interest parameter takes precedence over Import Extent. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.overwrite
member.summary: Overwrite Tiles (in, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ImportMapServerCache.out_job_url
member.summary: Output Map Service URL (out, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The parameters used by this tool. For internal use only.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles
member.summary: Creates and updates tiles in an existing web tile layer cache. This tool is used to create new tiles, replace missing tiles, overwrite outdated tiles, and delete tiles.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The web tile layer or map image layer whose cache tiles you want to update. (In, Required)
The scale levels at which you will create or delete tiles when running this tool, depending on the update_mode. (In, Required)
The mode for updating the cache. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.input_service
member.summary: The web tile layer or map image layer whose cache tiles you want to update. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.scales
member.summary: The scale levels at which you will create or delete tiles when running this tool, depending on the update_mode. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.update_mode
member.summary: The mode for updating the cache. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.num_of_caching_service_instances
member.summary: Defines the number of instances that will be used to update/generate the tiles. The value for this parameter is set to unlimited (-1) and cannot be modified. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.area_of_interest
member.summary: Defines an area of interest to constrain where tiles will be created or deleted. This parameter is useful if you want to manage tiles for irregularly shaped areas. It's also useful in situations where you want to pre-cache some areas and leave less-visited areas uncached. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.update_extent
member.summary: Rectangular extent at which to create or delete tiles, depending on the value of the update_mode parameter. It is not recommended you provide values for both update_extent and area_of_interest. If values for both parameters are provided, the value of area_of_interest will be used. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.wait_for_job_completion
member.summary: This parameter allows you to watch the progress of the cache job running on the Portal. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheTiles.out_job_url
member.summary: Output Map Service URL (out, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool.

member.summary: The alias for this tool's toolbox.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.ManageMapServerCacheStatus.report_extent

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UpgradeMapServerCacheStorageFormat
member.summary: Upgrades the compact cache storage format of a map or image service (created at 10.2.2 and earlier versions) to take advantage of performance improvements available at 10.3 and later versions.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UpgradeMapServerCacheStorageFormat.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The map or image service cache you want to upgrade. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UpgradeMapServerCacheStorageFormat.input_service
member.summary: The map or image service cache you want to upgrade. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ServerTools.UpgradeMapServerCacheStorageFormat.num_of_caching_service_instances
member.summary: The total number of instances of the System/CachingTools service that you want to dedicate toward running this tool. You can increase the maximum number of instances per machine of the System/CachingTools service using the Service Editor window available through an administrative connection to ArcGIS Server. Ensure your server machines can support the chosen number of instances. (In, Optional)
